author: TheMime005
title: Better Suited to Young Kids than Serious Collectors
review:
This set was packaged with issue 3 of the LEGO Elves magazine, April 2016. Therefore it is a minimalistic model with few pieces that includes a solitary figure to draw you in, the norm for magazine gifts. But does it hold its own as a small model? 

Pros

  • Includes cute Miku the dragon figure.

Cons

  • Parts are pretty common, with the exception of Miku the dragon figure & maybe the medium purple branch.
  • The model feels a little pathetic when truly examined, though part count limitations make this somewhat understandable.

Overall, this set is lacking in substance, though I still find it rather charming. But I wouldn't recommend it to TFOLs or AFOLs, unless you desperately want a Miku figure. Though if you are buying it solely for the model it will feel quite overpriced. 

However, for little kids who are interested in LEGO Elves, or fantasy in general, this would make a nice gift. And I'd say it would be ideal for children who tend to rebuild their LEGO sets, I'm sure lots of ideas would stem from the medium purple branch ;)
